title: About
text:
This site is put together for researchers who make use of SCB data.
We often have similar questions, and solve these problems and save the code used on our computers.
This site is a place to share this knowledge and get answers to specific questions.
We want to foster a similar environment to Statalist, but with a better culture!
The site is not endorsed by Statistics Sweden.

title: Guides
text:
The collection of guides put together by users is listed here.








  




Swedish Standard Classification of Occupations Crosswalk










 




No matching items

objectID: guides/Swedish Standard Classification of Occupations Crosswalk.html
href: guides/Swedish Standard Classification of Occupations Crosswalk.html
title: Swedish Standard Classification of Occupations Crosswalk
text:
Example post
Contrary to popular belief, comparing occupational groups across time is not a lost cause â€“ even when the classification standards change. In this guide, we will dive into the intricacies of the Swedish Standard Classification of Occupations, exploring the transition from SSYK 96 to SSYK 2012, and showing you that it is indeed possible to create a crosswalk that allows for meaningful comparisons across different years. By aligning the old and new classifications, we can gain valuable insights into the evolving landscape of the Swedish labor market and observe trends that might have otherwise gone unnoticed.
